name: HOTEL THOUSAND PILLARS (3 Star)
address: Kaloji Marg, Road, Opposite Ekasila Park, Advocates Colony, Balasamudram, Hanamkonda, Telangana 506001, India
summary: Unpretentious rooms in a relaxed hotel featuring a cigar lounge & a restaurant, plus breakfast.

top_reviews.author: Pavan Kumar
top_reviews.text:
Ordered from Swiggy ...
The taste was awesome..
The quality is too heavy ..
One dosa is tummy fulled for me ..
I thought I can eat poori and dosa ..
But single dosa is filled up ...

Taste was awesome 🤤😋
Have an try ...Dosa and Poori Was good..
In future I will try remaining food items too ..
You can see in updates ....

I must say, the experience was absolutely delightful! 😋🤤

The taste was simply amazing — every bite was packed with rich flavor and freshness. The quality of the food was excellent, far better than I expected. I ordered dosa and poori, thinking I could easily finish both, but to my surprise, just one dosa was so filling that it completely satisfied my hunger! The portion size was generous, and the texture of the dosa was perfectly crisp on the outside and soft inside.

The poori was equally delicious — light, fluffy, and paired wonderfully with the curry. Overall, the meal felt homely yet restaurant-quality at the same time.

If you’re someone who loves authentic South Indian flavors, I’d highly recommend giving this place a try. Both the dosa and poori are totally worth it.

I’m already looking forward to trying their other dishes in the future — stay tuned for my next food update! 🍽️✨

top_reviews.author: Uday Shetty
top_reviews.text:
We stayed at 1000 Pillar Hotel, Warangal, during our visit to the UNESCO World Heritage Site – Ramappa Temple at Palampet. Since options near the temple are limited, this was a convenient choice. The hotel is on the main road, easy to find, though some traffic noise can be heard in the rooms.

Rooms are spacious, clean, and well-furnished for a three-star property. The bathroom was fine, though a towel hook would help. Toiletries were decent, and the mini fridge was handy. Housekeeping and reception service were professional.

The restaurant food was average and a bit spicy for our taste. The walls are not soundproof, and we were disturbed by noise from nearby rooms.

Overall, a comfortable and practical hotel for visitors to Ramappa Temple and other heritage sites around Warangal.

top_reviews.author: Bhushan
top_reviews.text: This was a very comfortable stay, marked by excellent hospitality, hygiene, and a prime location. The entire staff is clearly well-trained, humble, and cooperative. We especially appreciated Johnson and his team in the restaurant; their service and warmth made the dining experience genuinely homely. A little more varieties of breakfast menu will be greatly appreciated.

top_reviews.author: Pavan Kumar
top_reviews.text: It’s an average place considering there are not many good hotels available in this town. It’s more of a budget hotel I would say. The rooms are decent size and have the basic amenities like TV, kettle, AC, locker water bottles and the bathroom was clean and neat too. The kettle wasn’t working but after raising a complaint they changed it. The room phone had some issue where I could not hear the person on the other side even after increasing the volume. Didn’t bother to ask them to change as they had a mobile number which could call for the reception and the restaurant. The restaurant food was good with south and North Indian dishes covered. The breakfast menu was limited though with no fruits at all on the menu. The location of the hotel is good as it’s easily accessible to most of the prominent places within 5 kms. Overall I would say a budget hotel without any perks for a short stay.

top_reviews.author: Pramod venkatrao
top_reviews.text:
One of the best service oriented hotel I have come across. Pleasantly surprised how good the food is. My wife’s birthday was celebrated here by the hotel team. Johnson in the morning was very efficient and courteous!
Will surely recommend this hotel to anyone!

name: Platform 65 - The Train Theme Restaurant
address: 2nd Floor Manikanka Gateway, XGRM+9WF, NIT Road, above Reliance Smart, Waddepally, Phase 1, Teachers Colony, Hanamkonda, Telangana 506004, India

top_reviews.author: Rajith Krishna Valluru
top_reviews.text:
All aboard the food train! 🍽️🚉
Visited this themed restaurant a few days ago and here’s my take 👇

🧸 The toy train delivering your food is definitely a hit with kids 🎠 — fun & interactive for sure 📸✨

🥘 But when it comes to the food... it's just OK at best 😐. Nothing that made our taste buds do a happy dance.
👨‍🍳 Service ? could’ve been much better. Felt a bit off track 🚦

✔️ Worth a one-time experience if you’ve got little ones or want to try something different… but don't expect a gourmet ride 🚂🍛

top_reviews.author: NIKITA KADAM
top_reviews.text: Excellent hotel for chicken biryani. Food atmosphere train theme service all is best. We went twice to this hotel on 25th and 26th June 2025. On 26th we were told train starts at 7pm. But we had to board train in evening. So we went around 6.15pm for food. To our surprise they served us food on train at 6.30pm. Excellent service. Loved food and everything. Even a small place can have such beautiful theme is surprising. Plz visit atleast once. I strongly recommend.

top_reviews.author: P R G
top_reviews.text: Platform 65 exceeded my expectations on every front. The food was wonderfully prepared, and the atmosphere was just right. I particularly appreciated the awesome food that was served. Even the drink complemented the meal perfectly. This experience left me feeling thoroughly impressed and satisfied. It's a restaurant that I will definitely be returning to.

Please don't go with kids, please check below images how chicken was

top_reviews.text:
Flavours need to be improved.
Great ambiance and huge seating area available. Reservations are to be done prior to visiting as there are chances of not available at time of visit.

The only issue is there are not any flavours for the food. So bland and not so satisfying. They need to improve a lot and the quantity of food is good and also the quality.

top_reviews.author: Shiva Martha
top_reviews.text:
Kursheed is well-known for its Hyderabadi Dum Biryani and is one of the oldest eateries in Warangal. We had their spicy Hyderabadi biryani served piping hot even at 1 AM, which was quite an experience.

While hygiene and cleanliness might raise concerns, especially given the age and setup of the place, the taste and overall experience were decent. It's a classic local spot that also serves food late into the night.

name: Aranyam Jungle Restaurant | Hanamkonda Warangal
address: 4th Floor, Fox Hills Complex, above Pantaloons, Nakkala Gutta, Hanamkonda, Telangana 506001, India

top_reviews.author: Sumair Aziz
top_reviews.text:
Aranyam truly stands out for its unique jungle-themed ambience — peaceful, beautifully designed, and perfect for a relaxed dining experience. The service is top-notch, with staff who are attentive and courteous.

When it comes to food, the starters steal the show — both veg and non-veg options are flavorful and well-prepared. However, the non-veg biryani is quite disappointing and definitely not worth the price. On the other hand, vegetarian dishes are superb, making them the real highlight of the menu.

Overall, it’s a place worth visiting for its ambience, service, and starters — just keep in mind that everything feels slightly overpriced for what’s served.

top_reviews.author: Himalaya goel
top_reviews.text:
Ambience is very good. Trying to give you an experience of a jungle by playing birds chirping sounds and water flowing musics.
Veg food is ok.

top_reviews.author: KrishnaMohan Vempati
top_reviews.text:
We visited Aranyam Jungle Theme Restaurant a few days ago for a family lunch, when we visited Warangal for Bhadrakali Temple and Thousand Pillars temple, and it turned out to be a great choice! The Jungle Themed ambiance was truly impressive and perfectly matched the restaurant’s name! It gave a unique and fun vibe, especially for a family outing.

We actually stepped in while looking for a good spot to celebrate our anniversary lunch, the valet parking caught our attention, and we’re so glad we chose this place!  The food was delicious, and the staff were courteous and attentive, even though the restaurant was quite busy with the weekend crowd.

While the serving style could use a bit of improvement (probably due to the rush), the overall experience was memorable. The creative jungle decor and atmosphere really made it stand out.
Definitely a place worth visiting for families and groups looking for something different!

top_reviews.author: Prashanth Varma
top_reviews.text: Worst staff they are providing uncooked frozen food .The manager was very rude and not responding to the customer request.Never vist such over rated restaurant.

top_reviews.author: P NARASIMHA RAO
top_reviews.text: It's a good multi cuisine restaurant in Pragathi Nagar, Kazipet. It has Ample food options from soups to starters , tandoori, biryanis and pulao. Pleasant atmosphere. Staff are very courteous and prompt. There is a live counter also. We ordered tandoori prawns and chicken wings. They taste nice. Later we ordered a chicken pulao family pack.  They prepared the pulao quickly and freshly in front of us only at the live counter and brought it to the table. But it doesn't meet the expectations. Overall worth a try at this restaurant.

top_reviews.author: Siddartha Gudimalla
top_reviews.text:
Absolutely Horrible Experience – Avoid This Place

I ordered a veg pulav and it was one of the worst food experiences I’ve ever had. The vegetables were rotten, the paneer was spoiled, and the overall dish smelled and tasted completely off. It was honestly disgusting and clearly not prepared with even basic hygiene or quality checks in mind.

Serving food in this condition is unacceptable. If this is the standard they operate with, it’s a serious health risk for customers. I’m extremely disappointed and won’t be ordering from here again.

Highly NOT recommended.

The samosa cutlet is also not worth mentioning. We couldn't eat it. Earlier, when I ordered pomegranate juice, they gave me beetroot juice mixed in it. Once upon the food here used to be very good. name: Paradise Biryani | Hanumakonda
address: Ground Floor, 2-5-673 & 2-5-674 Shastri Nagar, Main Rd, Subedari, Hanamkonda, Telangana 506001, India

top_reviews.author: saketh nani
top_reviews.text:
We ordered a Mutton Dum Biryani (Family Pack) and a Chicken Biryani from this restaurant on Diwali eve, trusting its brand value. Unfortunately, it turned out to be one of the worst food experiences we’ve had.

The rice was completely uncooked in parts, yet soggy and overcooked in others — it was wet, sluggish, and tasted like it had been boiled in excess water. It seemed like they mixed some plain grains of rice, reheated it, and sent it for delivery.

We paid nearly ₹2000 for this meal, but the quality was absolutely unacceptable. It’s not about the money — it’s about basic respect for customers and food hygiene. Please don’t risk your health or spoil your festive meal by ordering from this place.

top_reviews.author: jayanth ch
top_reviews.text:
No matter how great the sound of paradise resonates in Hyderabad, in Hanamkonda it is a pin drop silence kind of vibe.

The service was bad, I don't want to say bad because I feel bad for the only two people working for a 12 table dining. It's like burj khalifa standing on a single brick.

We sat for 10 mins and nobody would approach us, as you know, only two people are working. The plates weren't clean, the table is cleaned very poorly, just half half stuff.

The food was ok ok. It really seems paradise is overrated.

name: AROMA FINE DINE RESTAURANT & BANQUET HALL
address: 2H83+PFC Lopamudra arcade mall, above reliance trends, Lashkar Singaram, Naim Nagar, Warangal, Hanamkonda, Telangana 506009, India

top_reviews.author: Sujoy Saha
top_reviews.text:
This is the first experience in a fine dining restaurant in Telangana. Google reviews were good so we tried. First the ambience is good and quite. Good for family setting. Adjacent to the road but no sound from outside, another good point. Well illuminated. Overall nice decor.

Coming to food, it was very good. The starter was recommended by the waiter and came awesome. Nice flavour and moist chicken, that day's special. Special chicken Biriani was flavourful but light in heat. Good for two people. From myside a good five ⭐.

The icecream was slightly overpriced I guess and the like soda was not quite good. Here I feel they need to workout.

Highly recommend this place for people new to this area. The waiter was polite and other waitress was also good. They are know Telugu and English very well. From my side a good four star ⭐. Cheers.

top_reviews.author: Sankeerth Golkonda
top_reviews.text: Fine dining  at its best. Can visit with family and friends.  Window view is good.Reasonable prices when compared to other restaurants. Both starters and main course were tasty. The quality and ambience is commendable. The biryani is cooked well. Vegetarians can also get satisfied here .The staff politeness and service is good. There is a banquet hall too. They charge per plate around 550rs for veg and 650rs for non veg for items starting from welcome drink to Desserts.

top_reviews.author: dinesh anand
top_reviews.text: Be mindful of what you order & eat. You may find something unexpected. The food tasted really good. The ambiance was old fashioned, service was good. The quantity was good enough.

top_reviews.author: Dr. Pramod Kumar Poladi
top_reviews.text:
Visited on 18-10-2025
The quality of the food and service was good overall. We ordered a spicy Telangana chicken curry with butter naans, but were instead served a regular version of the curry in a smaller quantity. Additionally, the bill included extra charges for spice, which was not communicated beforehand and seemed higher than expected.

One disappointing observation was that no restaurant, including this one, is serving complimentary drinking water. Instead, they are charging double the MRP for bottled water, which feels quite unreasonable.
No valet Parking.

top_reviews.author: Melita Botelho
top_reviews.text: This place claims to be fine dining, which is not, the menu card was pathetic.I had ordered for special mutton biryani, however I got chicken piece in the SPECIAL MUTTON BIRYANI. There was a huge gathering in the banquet hall, while lunch was in the restaurant for 50 plus people . The people in the restaurants were disturbed.

name: President Dhaba | Warangal
address: ABOVE F.B.B SHOPPING MALL, Main Rd, Jagruti Colony, Naim Nagar, Hanamkonda, Telangana 506009, India

top_reviews.author: Pingili Venkat sai reddy.
top_reviews.text: President Dhaba offers a delightful dining experience with its warm ambience and beautifully designed interiors that instantly make you feel comfortable. The place stands out with its good lighting and nice visuals that add to the overall charm. The food is delicious, well-prepared, and served with great attention to taste and freshness, making every dish enjoyable. One of the best highlights is the spacious parking area, which makes visiting the restaurant completely hassle-free. Overall, President Dhaba is a great spot for family outings, friends’ gatherings, or a relaxed meal, combining great ambience, tasty food, and convenient parking.

top_reviews.author: Mayank Kashyap
top_reviews.text:
We visited President Dhaba in Warangal, and the overall experience was excellent. The ambience was simple yet comfortable, perfect for a relaxed meal.

Food:
The food was genuinely delicious. On the waiter’s recommendation, we tried the Chicken Dum Biryani — it was flavorful, aromatic, and easily one of the best biryanis I’ve had in Warangal. We also ordered Lemon Chicken (possibly Lemon 65), which had the perfect tangy-spicy balance and was very well prepared. Along with that, we tried a Veg Paneer Biryani, which was good, though not as remarkable as the chicken one. For drinks, we had Mango Lassi, Diet Coke, and Lime Soda — all refreshing and nicely served. Overall, the food quality and taste were impressive.

Service:
The service truly stood out. The waiter who attended to us was extremely polite, friendly, and attentive. He greeted us warmly, made great food suggestions, and ensured we were comfortable throughout. It’s rare to come across such genuine hospitality, and that really enhanced our dining experience.

Overall, President Dhaba is a must-visit in Warangal if you’re looking for good food, warm service, and a satisfying dining experience. Highly recommended!

top_reviews.author: gideon perikala
top_reviews.text:
Coffee Lounge, Warangal – A Cozy Hangout Spot with Good Vibes

I recently visited Coffee Lounge in Warangal, and it turned out to be a pleasant surprise. It’s a cozy and relaxing place, perfect for catching up with friends or spending some quiet time alone. The ambience is modern yet calm — with soft lighting, comfortable seating, and a decent music playlist that isn’t too loud.

I tried their cold coffee and a brownie with ice cream, both of which were well-prepared. The coffee had a strong, rich flavor without being too sweet, and the brownie was warm, soft, and balanced well with the ice cream.

The menu offers a decent variety — from hot and cold coffees to milkshakes, sandwiches, and snacks. Prices are quite reasonable for the quality and the setting.

The staff was polite, and service was smooth, though it took a little time during a busy hour. The café seemed clean and well-maintained.

👍 What I liked:
•	Relaxed atmosphere, perfect for casual meetings or solo time
•	Good coffee and dessert options
•	Polite service and reasonable prices

👎 What can improve:
•	Slightly faster service during peak time
•	More variety in food/snack options would be a plus

Final Word:

Coffee Lounge is a great little spot in Warangal for coffee lovers and people looking for a peaceful hangout. Whether you’re on a date, meeting friends, or just need a break — it’s a nice place to unwind with a cup in hand.

top_reviews.text: I ordered cappuccino but they served normal coffee and they charged 150rs per each.. Milk like water no coffee powder and just like shugar water. The atmosphere is terrific 💯 and everything is better than drinks. The cost is also very high.

Went there yesterday by a recommendation from a friend. Really happy that something like this has come up in our area.

The music put me off, not that it wasn’t good but it was very loud, not what a coffee lounge would put up. Anyway, the food disappointed me. The brownie was dry, like very dry. The garlic bread very very salty. Well I did give them a complaint for which they reacted very professionally and asked me to not pay for the bread. PS- I paid though. Good staff though.

This experience has raised serious concerns about the hygiene and food standards at this restaurant. I strongly request the concerned authorities to take strict action and consider shutting down Dolphin Restaurant to prevent others from facing similar health risks.

I also urge all food lovers, especially those who enjoy biryani, to avoid ordering from this restaurant for their own safety.

name: Hotel Amaravathi
address: Old VBR Complex, Tailors St, opp. Vijaya Bank, Ennugulagada, Gandhi Nagar, Reddy Colony, Hanamkonda, Telangana 506011, India

top_reviews.author: Anish A
top_reviews.text:
This iconic South Indian vegetarian restaurant in Hanamkonda Chowrasta has been a favorite for many years. Their breakfast menu is with traditional tiffins that are idlis, dosas,vadas and porri that are full of authentic flavor.

The veg meals are simple, wholesome, and a great option for lunch.

The tea and coffee here are also worth trying, making it a perfect stop for any time of the day.

Table service adds a personal touch, making the dining experience even better. Having enjoyed their food for years, I can confidently say this place is a must-visit for anyone looking for tasty and satisfying South Indian cuisine.

name: Alpaharam Hotel & Fusion 4 Non Veg Restaurant
address: Narsampet Rd, Labour Colony, Warangal, Telangana 506013, India

top_reviews.author: Remalesh v
top_reviews.text:
Alpaharam Hotel & Fusion 4 Non-Veg Restaurant – Very Disappointing Experience 😞
అల్పాహారం హోటల్ & ఫ్యూజన్ 4 నాన్ వెజ్ రెస్టారెంట్

I would not recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a decent dining experience in Khammam. My visit here was very disappointing — the place is extremely unhygienic, with no proper air conditioning, fans, or cleanliness.

The staff response was poor, and even for meals, it’s self-service — you have to go and collect rice and curries yourself. The food taste was below average, and overall service was not at all satisfactory.

If you’re planning to visit with your family or children, I strongly suggest avoiding this place. The environment is not suitable for families, and even parking is a big challenge. It’s surprising that they also run a function hall, considering how poorly the restaurant itself is maintained.

Honestly, this place seems suitable only for tea, coffee, or a quick smoke, not for proper meals or tiffins. I hope the management seriously works on cleanliness, service, and food quality.

⭐ Overall Rating: 1/5
📍 Near the bridge, Khammam

name: Biryanis and More
address: 2H74+X68, 5-11, Jagruti Colony, Naim Nagar, Hanamkonda, Telangana 506009, India

top_reviews.author: Srikanth Reddy
top_reviews.text: We had chicken lollipop , drumstick. Chicken fun biryani and boneless biryani to try for kids. Good place to have a tasty biryani and recommended for birthday events as well

top_reviews.author: Mayank Kashyap
top_reviews.text:
We visited Biryani’s and More in Warangal, and as the name suggests, it offers a wide variety of biryanis. The place itself is quite large, but the aesthetics and decor leave a lot to be desired — it feels functional rather than cozy or stylish.

Food:
We tried a few biryanis during our visit. One of them was extremely spicy — much spicier than we expected, while another, a regular dum biryani, was more balanced but just average in taste. Overall, the flavors were okayish, not as impressive as we had hoped considering the variety on the menu.

Value & Experience:
The prices were reasonable and not too expensive, so in terms of quantity and cost, it was fair. While the food was decent enough to satisfy hunger, the taste and overall experience were somewhat underwhelming compared to other biryani places in Warangal.

top_reviews.author: Nithish Prodduturi
top_reviews.text:
If you’re a true biryani lover, Palamuru Veg Biryani at this place is a must-try! 🍛🔥 The flavors were absolutely mouthwatering, with perfectly cooked rice, aromatic spices, and just the right amount of heat. 🌿🌶️ Every bite was packed with deliciousness, and the portion size was quite generous too! 😍👌

And oh, the Apricot Delight 🍑✨—it was a pure treat! Sweet, creamy, and melt-in-the-mouth, it left us craving for more. 🍮🤤 A perfect way to end the meal on a sweet note.

The ambiance was cozy, the service was quick, and the staff was super friendly. 👍😊 If you’re in Naimnagar, this is hands down one of the best restaurants to satisfy your cravings. Highly recommended!

top_reviews.author: THARUN GUNTUKU
top_reviews.text: I don't think a 3 course meal is ideal for this place, but you can definitely give a try to biryanis. We ordered chicken manchow soup, dragon chicken and chicken wings. They were very disappointing, the wings were so hard, the soup was so subtle and no spice, the manchow in the soup is massively thick which changes the feel of the soup. And we ordered a fry piece and dum in biryanis. They were good 👍. The service was a little slow but manageable. The ambience is good

top_reviews.author: Banda Gopal Reddy
top_reviews.text: Very good ambience, feel good environment. Provided wide variety of food choices, Taste and quantity of food is good . I recommend this restaurant in Hanamkonda as first choice🙌. Visit and get value to your money. Thank you guys😃

top_reviews.author: Vamshi Janagani
top_reviews.text:
This is hands down the worst mandi place I’ve ever been to in the Wgl-Hnk area.

Some places have great rice and chicken like Majesty Mandi.
Some have just amazing chicken, soft, tender, flavorful like Arabian Knights.
Some places has flavorful rice like Nawaabs.
Some mandi places have amazing soup that goes along with rice like Mandi.com.
Some offer tasty complimentary soup like Habibi’s mandi.
Some at least have great ambience even if the food flops, like Mandiwala.

But this had nothing going for it. Rice was bland, chicken was rubbery, and worst of all, the place was filthy, rice scattered everywhere, super uncomfortable
. “Jail Mandi” is the most fitting name ever, felt exactly like eating in a prison. The stairs alone felt like a stairway to hell. But hey, atleast The service was decent. That's a +ve i guess.

top_reviews.author: AMAAN
top_reviews.text: Mandi Darbar’s jail-themed concept is unique and adds an interesting vibe, but the overall execution falls short. The atmosphere is immersive, making you feel like you're in a prison, which is fun for photos, but the food doesn't match the experience. The mandi lacks the authentic flavors expected, and the seasoning feels off. Some dishes feel over-spiced, while others seem bland. The pricing is on the higher side compared to the quality. It’s a nice place for a one-time visit, especially if you're going for the theme, but not something that leaves a lasting impression food-wise.

name: KDR restaurant
address: beside Warangal hospital, opposite D Mart, Charbowli, LB Nagar, Warangal, Telangana 506002, India

top_reviews.author: Ganesh Makwani
top_reviews.text: This is a very nice restaurant whose taste is so good that it is different from other restaurants, if you ever come here then you must try it.

top_reviews.author: Shivam_ Bharadwaj
top_reviews.text:
I recently had the pleasure of dining at KDR Restaurant, and it turned out to be a delightful experience. Here's my detailed The food was flavorful, well-prepared, and served hot. The menu offers a wide range of options — from Indian classics to Indo-Chinese favorites. The paneer butter masala and chicken biryani were standouts — rich in taste and portioned generously. The spice levels were perfect, and everything tasted fresh.
The staff was polite, attentive, and quick to respond. They helped us choose some dishes and were courteous throughout. Service was a bit slow during peak hours, but nothing too frustrating.
The interiors were clean and well-lit, creating a comfortable dining environment. Whether you're with family, friends, or on a casual date, the space feels inviting and relaxed.
Reasonably priced for the quality and quantity of food. It's great value for money — especially if you're going in a group. Portions are decent and easily shareable.
Tables were sanitized, washrooms were clean, and the kitchen area looked well-maintained — always a big plus!

name: PAPILIO
address: Waddepally, Excise Colony, Hanamkonda, Telangana 506001, India

top_reviews.author: Pavan Kumar
top_reviews.text:
The PAPILO is a good cafe .
With pleasant atmosphere and music .
The prices of dishes are quite expensive but it worths .
We ordered chicken pizza and tiramasu .
Tast of those dishes very tooo yummy .😋..
Tiramasu is a blast and good treat for chocolate lovers .
If you are around warangal had a try in PAPILO .

Papilo Cafe is truly a gem in Warangal! The moment you step in, you’re welcomed by a warm and pleasant atmosphere with soothing music that makes the experience even better. The ambiance is modern yet cozy, perfect for hanging out with friends or enjoying a relaxed meal.

Yes, the prices are a bit on the higher side, but the quality and taste of the food make it absolutely worth it. We tried the chicken pizza and tiramisu, and both were outstanding. The pizza was perfectly baked with rich flavors, while the tiramisu was the highlight of our visit — creamy, indulgent, and a pure delight for chocolate lovers.

If you’re around Warangal and looking for a place that combines good vibes, great food, and a memorable dining experience, Papilo Café should definitely be on your list!

top_reviews.author: Pravalika
top_reviews.text:
Tried this café recently!🍴 Ordered Veg creamy pesto pasta. The spaghetti was super tasty — pasta cooked just right with a nice, rich sauce. Definitely worth ordering again. Cozy vibes and friendly staff made the visit even better.

Also tried the mushroom sandwich… let’s just say it’s more on the “simple comfort food” side. Not the star of the menu, but it does the job.

One thing though, the prices are on the higher side 💸, so it’s more of a treat spot than an everyday café.

Overall, a nice spot I’d return to, especially for that spaghetti!

top_reviews.author: karthik mylavarapu
top_reviews.text:
Great Taste & Presentation, But a Bit Pricey

I recently visited, and I was impressed with both the taste and presentation of the food.

The quality and quantity were well-maintained, ensuring a satisfying experience.

Each dish was beautifully plated, and the flavors were spot on.

However, the pricing felt slightly on the higher side compared to similar places.

While the overall experience was great, a bit more affordability would make it even better. Still, if you’re looking for a place that values taste and presentation, this cafe is definitely worth a visit!

top_reviews.author: Pingili Venkat sai reddy.
top_reviews.text:
Papilio is a delightful spot that truly stands out when it comes to ambience and desserts. From the moment you walk in, you’re welcomed by a warm and elegant setting that strikes the perfect balance between cozy and classy. Whether you’re here for a romantic dinner or a relaxed hangout with friends, the vibe is just right.

What really stole the show, though, were the desserts. Every bite felt like a treat crafted with care – rich, flavorful, and beautifully presented. From creamy cheesecakes to gooey brownies and exotic specials, the dessert menu at Papilio is a paradise for anyone with a sweet tooth.

The food overall was quite good too, but it’s the desserts that truly shine and leave a lasting impression. Service was courteous and timely, adding to the overall positive experience.

If you’re someone who appreciates a perfect dining atmosphere paired with heavenly desserts, Papilio is a must-visit. It’s one of those places you’ll definitely want to return to – not just for the food, but for the overall feel and quality experience.

top_reviews.author: Sanghavi
top_reviews.text:
Papilio’s all about the vibes aesthetic, cozy, and Insta worthy.But when it comes to taste vs price? The math isn’t mathing
Cute place for a one-time visit, not a flavor favorite..

name: Avantha Grand Family Restaurant
address: Ursu Gutta Road, WHWX+636, Khammam Bypass Rd, near Talla Padmavathi Pharmacy college, Rangashaipet, Warangal, Telangana 506005, India

top_reviews.author: Vamshi Janagani
top_reviews.text:
I recently dined at Avantha Grand Family Restaurant with my friends. The restaurant's ambiance was impressive, creating a calm and enjoyable atmosphere. One notable aspect of the restaurant is the wide variety of items available on the menu, offering ample choices to suit different preferences. However, our go-to choice was the Chicken Dum Biryani, and it did not disappoint.
The biryani was excellently prepared, with the right amount of spiciness that suited my taste buds perfectly. The chicken pieces were tender, smooth, and packed with flavor. The accompanying gravy complemented the biryani wonderfully. The quantity served was sufficient to satisfy our appetites. We also appreciated the availability of cold drinks to accompany our meal.
Additionally, the price of the biryani was reasonable, which further added to the positive aspects of the restaurant. To be honest, I couldn't find any downsides or cons during my dining experience at Avantha Grand Family Restaurant. It truly provided an enjoyable and satisfying meal

top_reviews.author: Soorya 99
top_reviews.text: One of the best restaurants out there for the travellers. Tried their Butter Garlic naan, Kadai Paneer, Vanilla milkshake, Everything was spot on. Moderately priced. The hospitality by the staff Personal was exemplary. Would visit this place again.

top_reviews.text: I have visited this restaurant twice before and the food was very good, so I had good expectations. But my recent order was very disappointing. top_reviews.text: This restaurant was a blast and was amazing when I visited Warangal. Loved the ambience , the prompt service and the quality of Veg thali. I went for the South Indian thali, the taste and quality of food didn’t disappoint. Also, would say that this restaurant is a total bang for your buck. Highly recommended if you are in Warangal on the lookout for a delicious meal.

top_reviews.author: Rahul Chandrashekar
top_reviews.text:
Pure vegetarian restaurant in a small bylane inside a busy street. Reaching the restaurant was a challenge on its own as the bylanes leading to the restaurant are very narrow and once you get here, you might be wondering where to park the car.
Once the parking concern was sorted, we headed to the second floor on the building and were pleasantly glad to see the ambience.
Though a very small place, the interior is a bit more than decent.
The service was good and we ordered a South Indian meals along with a North Indian meals. The price is very reasonable for the number of dishes you get in the thalis. We also ordered a sweet lassi and a buttermilk which was just fine.
Definitely a good place to have a decent meal if you ignore the parking issue.

top_reviews.author: Dayakar D
top_reviews.text: The service is absolutely the very worst. I never expected this from them. The reason is that tonight I placed an order at 8:18 PM, and waited until 8:50 PM. However, they started giving my order to people who came after me without giving it to me. What is this? Even after I told them I was with my family—ladies and kids were waiting on the road—they kept saying they would give it, but they never did. When I questioned them firmly, the person said, 'You have to wait, or I will return your amount.' They spoke as if we were helpless or had no other choice, and as if they were giving us something for free. When there is such a busy crowd, they should at least implement some kind of token system for service. Instead, they prioritize their favorites, or perhaps 'white-collar' or 'premium' customers, and serve them first.

Never heard of this place before but for a quick snack I would definitely recommend this,  as the price is low with taste better than some well known places. Great.

name: December Delights
address: 2H42+2RF, Gokul Nagar, Gokulnagar, Hanamkonda, Telangana 506001, India

top_reviews.author: SuHarsha Vardhan Reddy
top_reviews.text:
Having followed their Instagram page for quite some time, I was eager to visit December Delights Cafe during my trip to India from Canada. To my absolute shock, I found the prices to be remarkably reasonable, making it accessible for everyone to indulge in delightful Western cuisine.

This establishment has truly brought a taste of the West to Warangal. I sampled a variety of dishes, including the Veg Machow Soup, Peri Peri Fries, Fish Bites, Alfredo Pasta, and Mixed Hakka Noodles. Each dish was nothing short of perfection—an embodiment of culinary brilliance.

From the moment I arrived, I was greeted with warmth by RK, whose hospitality was exceptional, along with Ravi, who attended to our table with great care. The team’s coordination was impressive, reflecting a well-orchestrated effort to ensure a memorable dining experience.

While I noticed some reviews expressing concerns about authenticity, it’s essential to appreciate the meticulous effort they put into recreating these Western dishes while infusing them with the unique essence of Warangal. Hats off to the team for their creativity and dedication!

I wholeheartedly recommend December Delights Cafe to family and friends, and I look forward to returning soon.

top_reviews.author: THARUN GUNTUKU
top_reviews.text:
I would give a solid 3.5 stars out of 5 for this place. Great ambience and polite staff. We Started with Chicken Manchow soup (5/5), it was really good, the spice levels, thickness of soup, everything was spot on. We asked for their recommendation when it came to appetizers, they advised to go with
1) Grilled chicken with garlic sause(3.5/5)
2) Peri peri chicken wings (3.5/5)
One thing I noticed here with the appetizers is their style of cooking is more towards subtle side ( It’s not too spicy, salty, sweet, or tangy everything is balanced and mild). So if you are someone who like your food more spicy, try mentioning it while you are placing your order and wait to see how it turns out. Being someone who likes spicy food, though I haven't mentioned, It turned out decent to me. We've Also ordered Chicken tikka large Pizza, which was decent.
It is highly obvious that most of us find the quantity they provide towards a lower side because, remember you are not walking into a restaurant, it's a cafe, meant for lighter meals.

top_reviews.author: Swami Vivekananda
top_reviews.text: Hospitality was Good, Food was amazing especially kids loved it more those varities. Happy to meet DD Co-founder Supraja with our family and having good conversation. Wishing to Visit again.

top_reviews.author: praveen bathini
top_reviews.text: One of my friend who follows December Delight on Instagram told me to check this place out when I came to India from Australia, and it didn’t disappoint! 😍 I ordered a latte, tiramisu, pasta, and noodles everything was super tasty, but the latte stole the show ☕🔥. Tastes just like the ones I have overseas! Definitely a must-try spot and the noodles were a bit spicy, but that's on me,I didn't mention it while ordering 😅. Worth a visit.

top_reviews.author: Rock Star Ravi A
top_reviews.text:
⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ A Truly Delightful Experience at December Delights

From the moment I stepped into December Delights, I knew I was in for something special. The ambiance is warm and inviting, with tasteful décor, cozy seating, and soft lighting that strikes a perfect balance between being elegant and comfortable. It’s a place where you can relax with friends or enjoy a quiet dinner.

The menu is impressively diverse — North Indian, Chinese, Thai, Continental, desserts, and more.  Each dish I ordered was thoughtfully prepared:

The creamy pasta was absolutely heavenly — rich, flavorful, and perfectly cooked.

Their coffees deserve special praise: well-brewed, bold yet smooth — exactly what you look for in a café.

The desserts and drinks stand out too — from bubble teas to cheesecakes, every sweet treat felt like it was made with care.

What makes December Delights even more remarkable is the service. The staff are friendly, attentive, and genuinely eager to make your experience delightful. They were happy to customize dishes, accommodate special requests, and guide me through the menu.

In terms of value, while it leans toward the premium side, the quality, ambiance, and service more than justify the pricing. On JustDial, it already enjoys a strong reputation — rated 4.8 by many customers.

If I had to mention something to improve — occasionally a dish could be hotter at the time of serving — but that’s a minor quibble in an otherwise exceptional dining experience.

top_reviews.text:
🌟 KFC 🌟

I recently ordered the Big Chicken Bucket from KFC, and it was absolutely outstanding! The chicken was crispy, juicy, and packed with that signature KFC flavor I always love.

The service was super — quick, friendly, and efficient. The ambience was very nice, clean, and comfortable, making it a great place to enjoy a meal with friends or family.

top_reviews.author: siri velpula
top_reviews.text:
Absolutely terrible experience.

You place an order through the display board, and it shows a message saying, “Kitchen has received your order.” So you wait. And wait. Only after a long delay  and after asking the staff they suddenly tell you, “You need to collect the token receipt from the counter.” Really? So until that moment, the order wasn’t even passed to the kitchen. That’s not just poor service  that’s outright misleading. The system is a joke.
There aren’t enough tables, no proper parking, and the entire setup is a mess. The place feels overcrowded, uncomfortable, and badly managed.
The staff? Useless. You ask them for help, and they either ignore you or respond with a lazy, “Wait there.” Wait where? For how long? No one knows  because they clearly don’t. I waited 40 - 45  minutes for a basic order , and when it finally arrived, it was cold and unappetizing.
If you’re even remotely hungry and value your time or money, avoid this place at all costs. The service is pathetic, the system is broken, and the whole experience is too frustrating.

top_reviews.text:
I recently visited Skyla restaurant with my friends.
Starters :
We started with the dragon paneer, which had a delightful crunch on the outside and a smooth texture inside, along with a perfect blend of spices that tantalized our taste buds.👍🏽 Unfortunately, the paneer majestic, our second starter, was a bit of a letdown. It lacked the necessary salt and spice, making it rather bland.👎🏽

For our main course, we ordered butter naans, which were decent, but not as delicate and smooth as other places we've tried. We paired them with Chettinaad paneer, which was a standout dish - delicious and flavorful. The garlic naan was another winner, better than the butter naan.

I should also mention that while the ambiance of the restaurant was pleasing, unfortunately, the state of the washrooms were disappointing. They were quite unclean.

Although the food was generally good, the prices were a little steep, and overall, our experience was just okay.

top_reviews.author: Pingili Venkat sai reddy.
top_reviews.text: Taaza Tiffins is one of the best places to enjoy authentic South Indian breakfast, known for its excellent tiffins that are both delicious and hygienically prepared. The dosas, especially the ghee karam dosa and masala dosa, are crispy and full of flavor, while the idlis, vadas, and pooris are soft, fresh, and satisfying. Their chutneys, particularly the thick coconut chutney, are a favorite among regulars, although sambar is usually not served. The restaurant maintains a clean and tidy environment, and the service is fast, making it perfect for a quick and fulfilling meal. Prices are very affordable, making it a great value for the quality offered. While some branches may have limited seating or occasional inconsistency in taste, the overall experience is highly praised. For anyone looking for a tasty, traditional tiffin experience, Taaza Tiffins is a must-visit.

top_reviews.author: Mallik Rajesh
top_reviews.text: I recently visited TAAZA TIFFINS @Hanamkonda that left me feeling extremely disappointed. The service was slow and unprofessional, and the food was terrible. My order was  Vada and the dish I received was cold and unappetising. Sambar is not being served along with Vada instead they are charging for that. Overall, my experience was extremely unpleasant and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone. Save your money and go elsewhere for a better dining experience...

top_reviews.author: Raghavendra Bugade
top_reviews.text:
Taaza Tiffins in Hanamakonda is a fantastic spot for breakfast and quick South Indian meals. Known for its fresh and flavorful food, this eatery consistently delivers on taste and quality. The menu offers a variety of classic South Indian dishes like idli, dosa, vada, and upma, all served with generous portions of chutneys and sambar. Their dosa, crispy and golden, is a crowd favorite, while the soft, fluffy idlis are perfect for a light and satisfying meal.

The restaurant’s ambiance is clean, simple, and inviting, ideal for families and individuals alike. The service is quick and efficient, even during busy hours, ensuring a smooth dining experience. The staff are courteous and attentive, further adding to the restaurant’s appeal.

One of the standout features of Taaza Tiffins is its affordability. Despite the high-quality food, the prices remain pocket-friendly, making it a great choice for everyday dining. Parking can be slightly challenging during peak times, but the quality of food and service more than make up for it.

Overall, Taaza Tiffins is a go-to destination for anyone seeking authentic, delicious, and budget-friendly South Indian food in Hanamakonda. Whether you’re stopping by for breakfast or a quick snack, you won’t be disappointed!

top_reviews.author: Revanth BalaBoyina
top_reviews.text: Taaza tiffins seems to be one of the branch from hyderabad where i'd like to eat. No doubt in quality of food, they use R.O water which is a good sign. I would definitely suggest to visit this place

top_reviews.author: Bharath Basabathini
top_reviews.text:
First of all the person at the cash counter know only hindi/urdu. Am I eating in North India?? No. Cash counter person should know telugu also which is local language.
2. Sambar is not being served along with idli which is mandatory for any South Indian tiffin. You can reduce the chutney quantity and serve a cup of sambar too without charging extra money.
3.I had idli and masala dosa. Taste was just ok. The potatoes in the masala were not mashed enough to look smooth and without any taste.

All these are improvable things.

top_reviews.author: Vamshi Janagani
top_reviews.text: We tried Choco Almond, Shocking Current (from happiness in a jar), and Nutty Nuts milkshake. All tasted great, sweet and nutty but not overpowering, balanced well. But, Shocking Current lived up to its name, tasted like some weird tonic, felt like i was on some medication. Quantity felt less for the price, and they don’t even accept UPI, just cash or card. Stood there like a clown with my phone.

top_reviews.text:

But only issue is they only take cash NO UPI/CREDITCARD/DEBITCARD

top_reviews.author: DS
top_reviews.text:
I tried the build your own ice cream which was for 224 after the tax.  They did not explain before hand that you can only order from the limited ice cream menu when you do so, leaving me with only 5 options for ice cream. Even though it says 5 toppings are allowed, they said you can take only brownie or Nutella or rocher. They should make this clearer on the menu.

The service was also disappointing. The server was rude and did not seem interested in taking my order. They seemed unorganised and in attentive. I rarely leave a bad review but I was disappointed with my experience here.

top_reviews.text: Prices are slightly to the heavier side , but the taste is heaven .There are plenty of varieties including sugar free concepts which are delicious too and the ambience is good but it is almost crowdy all the time. Portions can be increased a little. No UPI is a major drawback.

top_reviews.author: Sridhar Yamsani
top_reviews.text: I get to know about this by my daughter which is very popular sweet shop in Warangal. It happened to visit this shop recently along with my family. We had Kaman Dhokla and Kachori which are our favorite dishes while we were in Mumbai and we never get the similar taste in any where else even in Hyderabad. The taste of both dishes were really good and we liked it very much. Particularly Kachori's were served with the fillings similar to rajbog kachori. The curd was not added in the fillings but still we enjoyed it. They have wide varieties of sweets. It's a must visit place.

top_reviews.author: Mohammed
top_reviews.text: I absolutely love Ramnivas Sweets & Namkeen! 🍬 Their treats are always fresh and incredibly delicious. Every visit is a delightful experience. Highly recommend for anyone with a sweet tooth! 😋✨

top_reviews.text: This outlet has been selling top quality sweets and savouries since 1921 which is legendary. They have updated with latest showroom at the same place with awesome ambience,sitout. Worth visiting this place and value for money.

top_reviews.text: One of the oldest sweets shop of Hanamkonda. Visited after a decade and happy to see them moving into a new location. Top notch sweets and namkeen, very neatly maintained place to sit in and snack on your favourite item.

name: Pista House - Warangal
address: 2 ND FLOOR ABOVE WEST SIDE, SHYAMALA'S KAKATIYA SQUARE NIIT SUBEDARI ROAD, HANMAKONDA, Phase 1, Teachers Colony, WARANGAL, Hanamkonda, Telangana 506004, India

top_reviews.author: Vamshi Janagani
top_reviews.text:
I’d been dying to try this place since Pista House is super famous. First off, the ambience is really cool, clean, calm, and comfy seating. We started with the Pathar ka Chicken special; it had a nice smoky flavor, but the taste felt totally off, not spicy at all, and I like my food spicy. Green chutney saved it a bit.

Then we had Butter Naan with Hyderabadi Chicken Curry. This was the highlight, good spice, tasty curry, and enough quantity for two naans. But the chicken wasn’t tender. And the naan was disappointing , Honestly, one of the worst I’ve ever had, its rubbery, hard to tear, and just frustrating to eat.

Finally, we tried the Zafrani Chicken Biryani... and wow, that was the sweetest biryani I’ve ever had. Please, move this to the dessert section of the menu. Made me hate biryani for a second.

Prices were a bit high, but service was great. Now I finally get what they mean when they say food’s not always great at famous places.

top_reviews.author: Sanjib Dey Choudhury
top_reviews.text:
Food is average. There is a huge quality difference between Hyderabad Branch and this one.
The Taste doesn't justify the price.

top_reviews.author: Megha T
top_reviews.text: Went here with family.Food came really fast and tasted great. Service and atmosphere were both very good👍.Definitely recommend this place.😍

top_reviews.author: Syed Rafan Ahmed
top_reviews.text:
At the beginning of Pista house restaurant it was good. But now the case is reversed. Both dinning and take away are worst now. The day when I took take away staff forgot to cook food and on multiple requests they gave food after 40 mins. Attached is the bill and burned butter nan. They have given burned butter nan and less nan quantity than billed one. When I call for the reason staff was telling do what ever you want but this is what we serve. This is the Situation of Pista house now.
Think more before you visit Pista house..🤢

top_reviews.author: Alankrutha Chandra
top_reviews.text: Felt really good being served the perfectly cooked veg dum biryani with medium spice level. Loved the care and attention that they have put into the vegetarian dish. Thank you for making me hopeful. Biryani is yum. Please maintain the quality in the future too. It will be my go to biryani place in hanmakonda. I will bring all my friends and family here. Don’t even try any other place. All other restaurants serve biryani with rice cooked separately and then add some gravy curry which is not dum. Please don’t change your spice level for the people who are leaving negative reviews for the spice level. It’s insane that every other restaurant serve them and some people even add chilli powder in the rice. Remain authentic to the recipe and people will adapt to the taste.

summary: Popular delivery, carry-out & dine-in chain known for pizza, wings & pasta, plus sides & desserts.

top_reviews.author: Sharon Dubey
top_reviews.text: So firstly it's a very pleasant place to visit, as u can see it's well maintained and the staff behavior is very humble and service oriented. We visited there back to back in two weeks and both the times they suggested the best. Don't forget to ask for offers they have like 1+1 or some discount etc as it may not be mentioned on the menu. It's open till 11 at night to dine in... But if u want to sit and eat without hurry be there by atleast 10:30-10:40. Post 11 only take away for a limited time.

top_reviews.author: Ameerah Tasneem
top_reviews.text:
I am from warangal myself and my cousins. have planned to go to pizza hut to eat pizza there was unlimited offer pizza  which was around 200 we all paid their money  when pizza arrived we can only eat 3 and the service is verry bad . They were bringing each pizza 15 minutes each
Late.  we came around 6 by the time we went it was 8:30 and after we went home there was intense pain in my stomach. got diarrhea.  When I asked my cousins all of them have same problem as mine what they have added dont know but from 3 days the condition is still same dont wver visit this place I don't know whixh type of things they used thank got I ate only 3 if I ate more it can be more problem  .
